metadata.synopsis: Oskar's conclusion. After fighting off kerri, oskar comes to. Depending on whether he has seen Kerri's true form (i.e if he was knocked out or not when the fight began), he will be more or less devastated.
metadata.how_to_trigger: It will start automatically after killing Kerri Evenfield.CTY_Main_A -250; 29; -45

67.speaker: Oskar Fevras
67.text: My love, sweet Fireliia. I can explain everything.

44.speaker: Lady Jannath
44.text: I don't want to hear it - you nearly got us killed. Oh gods, I'll be a laughing stock when this comes out.

79.speaker: Oskar Fevras
79.text: But my love, I did it for us. How else was I to put her behind me?
79.context: NodeContext: Genuinely baffled, thought he did the right thing

69.speaker: Oskar Fevras
69.text: My friend here can vouch for me. For how seriously I took our marriage.
69.context: CinematicNodeContext: Oskar nods his head, silently pleading for the player to back him up

47.speaker: Player
47.text: He genuinely respects you, Lady Jannath. Even if he is an idiot.

7.speaker: Lady Jannath
7.text: Hmm. I suppose one last chance won't do any harm.

73.speaker: Player
73.text: You ran away to avoid it. Your marriage is a sham.

11.speaker: Oskar Fevras
11.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns to Jannath, knows he's in deep trouble nowNodeContext: Utter disbelief and panic

72.speaker: Lady Jannath
72.text: I want you gone from this house by nightfall.

50.speaker: Lady Jannath
50.text: If being married to me is so awful, then you can bloody well fend for yourself.

55.speaker: Player
55.text: Erm, yes. He always said how much he valued your relationship...

12.speaker: Oskar Fevras
12.text: Ahem. Well, I confess, at first I saw you as a patron first, and a lover second. But now I feel differently.
12.context: NodeContext: Awkward, trying to justify himself

85.speaker: Lady Jannath
85.text: Is that so? And what exactly changed your mind?
85.context: NodeContext: Not yet ready to forgive him

77.speaker: Oskar Fevras
77.text: Please, my darling. Give me one final chance?

15.speaker: Lady Jannath
15.text: I suppose you aren't the one to blame in all this. Though you've got a lot of grovelling to do.
15.context: NodeContext: Witha  sigh at the start - reluctantly forgiving him

62.speaker: Lady Jannath
62.text: I think it's best you go back to your painting for a while, Oskar. I need some space.

60.speaker: Oskar Fevras
60.text: Of course, my darling. I completely understand.

34.speaker: Oskar Fevras
34.text: When you're recovered from our little skirmish, join me up there, my friend. I believe we've a debt to settle.
34.context: NodeContext: A bit embarassed, trying to sount positive about the 'debt' (he'll make a painting of you)

38.speaker: Player
38.text: This is between the two of you.

14.speaker: Lady Jannath
14.text: That's just the problem, isn't it? It was never just the two of us.
14.context: NodeContext: Like this is some bitter joke

58.speaker: Lady Jannath
58.text: I know we're neither of us in our first flush of youth, but this... It's untenable.
58.context: NodeContext: An unhappy conclusion, taking control of her fate

65.speaker: Lady Jannath
65.text: Perhaps your next patron will be more forgiving than I.

29.speaker: Player
29.text: If you want my relationship advice, that's going to cost extra.

35.speaker: Lady Jannath
35.text: Your friend is as cynical as you are, Oskar.
35.context: CinematicNodeContext: With an eyebrow raiseNodeContext: Like this is some bitter joke

24.speaker: Lady Jannath
24.text: I had hoped there was more to our relationship than the size of my coffers. Clearly I was mistaken.
24.context: NodeContext: An unhappy conclusion, taking control of her fate

51.speaker: Lady Jannath
51.text: No doubt you'll land on your feet. Or some other foolish noble will pick you up.

21.speaker: Oskar Fevras
21.text: I understand, Fireliia. And truly - I am sorry.

75.speaker: Lady Jannath
75.text: You may as well have this - consider it payment, for allowing me to see the truth at last.
75.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lady Jannath removes her wedding ring and hands it to the player (can be unseen if this can't be done in booth)

71.speaker: Player
71.text: Improvise a song detailing Oskar's love and devotion for Fireliia.

78.speaker: Lady Jannath
78.text: Oskar... this song. Is it true?
78.context: NodeContext: she's just heard a  beautiful song about how her husband *does* lover after being given evidence otherwise

42.speaker: Oskar Fevras
42.text: Oh, you - err. (Why on earth did you sing?)
42.context: NodeContext: italics are whispered, chastising someone who's just burst out into terrible song

23.speaker: Lady Jannath
23.text: Words as empty as the tune is tired. I think we're done here.

30.speaker: Oskar Fevras
30.text: Gods, what a mess I've made of it all.

54.speaker: Oskar Fevras
54.text: My sweet Fireliia. I've been a rotten fool, haven't I? And yet you never left my side...

81.speaker: Lady Jannath
81.text: It will take more than a ghost to scare me away. Though I wish you'd come to me sooner.
81.context: NodeContext: A bit annoyed, but not enough to escalate things further

83.speaker: Oskar Fevras
83.text: I - I'd like to stay. I confess, I never felt ours was a marriage of substance. I rather thought you just liked me for my art.

39.speaker: Player
39.text: That's it? You're just going to forgive him?

82.speaker: Lady Jannath
82.text: I'm no fool. I know Oskar loved another when we met. But when we made our vows, I meant them.

45.speaker: Oskar Fevras
45.text: Throughout my ordeal, I saw how tenderly you cared for me. Even at my worst, you never left my side.
45.context: NodeContext: 'Condition' referring to his being possessed by the ghost of his dead lover

43.speaker: Oskar Fevras
43.text: Truly, you were the one who saved me. I'm so sorry, my darling.
43.context: NodeContext: Genuine apology, but he can't quite help caveating it at the end

8.speaker: Player
8.text: I wish you both a long and happy marriage.

27.speaker: Oskar Fevras
27.text: Please - before you go. I must pay you back.

57.speaker: Oskar Fevras
57.text: Come upstairs, to my atelier. I promise you'll leave with something priceless. Immortality.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: Jannath deserves more than an apology for what you put her through.

33.speaker: Oskar Fevras
33.text: A debt I'll spend a lifetime repaying.
33.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking tenderly at Lady Jannath

76.speaker: Oskar Fevras
76.text: As for you, my noble friend - our account can be settled far more quickly.

80.speaker: Player
80.text: Excuse me? I saved you. And I need paying for it.

41.speaker: Oskar Fevras
41.text: But of course. I'm a man of my word, and the word was 'compensation'.

56.speaker: Player
56.text: Saccharine nonsense. You two make me sick.

70.speaker: Oskar Fevras
70.text: Romance isn't for everyone, I suppose. Still - you brought us back together, and for that, I can't thank you enough.

28.speaker: Player
28.text: At least you'll have a great story to tell the grandchildren.

66.speaker: Lady Jannath
66.text: Perhaps not. I think this sorry episode is best left out of the family history. Though it was quite the adventure.

63.speaker: Oskar Fevras
63.text: Such torments I put you through, my love, but even at my worst, you never left my side. I'm so very sorry.

74.speaker: Player
74.text: What a touching reunion. Now, about my payment...

52.speaker: Oskar Fevras
52.text: My love, sweet Fireliia. She is gone, and I am left with nothing.

59.speaker: Oskar Fevras
59.text: I need some time to process this. To understand... what I've done.

3.speaker: Player
3.text: I'd say you've done well out of all this. Lady Jannath's estate is yours now.

4.speaker: Oskar Fevras
4.text: No, no it isn't. She was always a pragmatist, and made sure our marriage contract left her estate protected.
4.context: NodeContext: Matter of fact, not bitter about it

26.speaker: Oskar Fevras
26.text: Some distant cousin will no doubt claim the house in due course, and I'll be on the streets once more.
26.context: NodeContext: Matter of fact, not bitter about it

84.speaker: Player
84.text: Don't be too hard on yourself. Mystic Carrion manipulated you.

9.speaker: Oskar Fevras
9.text: Perhaps. But he only preyed on what was already there.

22.speaker: Oskar Fevras
22.text: I suppose you came here to ask for your portrait?

64.speaker: Oskar Fevras
64.text: I'm afraid I'm rather lacking inspiration at the moment. Perhaps my sketchbook will be sufficient payment - it might be worth something, one day.
64.context: NodeContext: In shock, trying his best

6.speaker: Player
6.text: There are consequences to our actions. Especially selfish ones.

46.speaker: Oskar Fevras
46.text: Of course. And I thought I'd become rather good at avoiding them. With your help, of course.

17.speaker: Oskar Fevras
17.text: Unfortunately, I'm rather stumped on this one. It's all over. All gone.

25.speaker: Oskar Fevras
25.text: Of course. We had an agreement, didn't we? I was supposed to paint your portrait.
